answer:
If you have concerns about your health, please make an appointment with your health care provider. Speak with a nurse anytime at HealthLinkBC by calling 8-1-1.
Vaccine safety is important. Changes in health that occur after the receipt of a vaccine have to meet specific criteria to be reported as a potential adverse event following immunization. Concerns about a potential side effect after a vaccine can be discussed with a nurse at your local health unit. Our health unit finder is here.  
Immunization Nurse
question: In the fall of 2014 I had a flu vaccine and the pharmacist used iodine as he did not have alcohol. Ever since I have skin flacking off and the girth of the arm is less. Cure?
question_variation_2: why skin flacks off when i'm on it
